thread.title: Free (or cheap) for kids on Long Island
thread.title_full: Free (or cheap) for kids on Long Island | Newsday

author: newsday.com
title: Free (or cheap) for kids on Long Island
text:
Head to Nissequogue River State Park, where you'll identify and tap a maple tree in hopes of striking "liquid gold." The family-friendly, hands-on program starts indoors with an explanation of the tools needed for the sugaring, then heads outdoors with an environmentalist to get down to business. WHEN | WHERE 1:30 p.m. Saturday, Feb. 4, 799 St. Johnland Rd., Kings Park. Reservations required. INFO 631-581-1072, nysparks.com ADMISSION $4 (free younger than 3 unless participating)
(Credit: Daniel Goodrich)
Need weekend plans or something to do with the kids during the week?
There are a ton of free children's events at local libraries, but we also found free and cheap things to do elsewhere this month.
Whether you have one, two, three or more kids in tow, here's a roundup of fun, budget-friendly events on Long Island....
